text: St. Stephens is an unincorporated community in Fremont County, Wyoming, United States. It is home to the St. Stephens Indian Mission.Saint Stephens Indian Mission Foundation history In Summer 2015, St. Stephens hosted an Arapaho language camp. ==Notable people == *Constantine Scollen the famous missionary was a priest here amongst the Arapaho between 1890 and 1892. ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Fremont County, Wyoming Category:Unincorporated communities in Wyoming Category:1884 establishments in Wyoming Territory
title: St. Stephens, Wyoming
